definition: to confer/to grant/to bestow a title/to seal/classifier for sealed objects, esp. letters

sentences.english: Jets of water kept coming out of the broken pipe. Even the street had to be closed.
sentences.chinese: 管线破掉，不断地喷出水柱，连街道都必须封锁了。

sentences.english: The blockade was raised last night.
Fourthly, to break the blockade from the all-round opening up.
sentences.chinese: 第四，从打破封锁到全方位对外开放。

sentences.english: The US and Britain airlift supplies into a Berlin blockaded by the USSR.
sentences.chinese: 美国和英国向被苏联封锁的柏林地区空投物资。

sentences.english: Police parked vans in front of the cathedral to block access to the nearby LSE.
sentences.chinese: 警察通过设置路障封锁了通往伦敦证交所的通道。

sentences.english: Despite his insubordination, Dofine remained in command of the blockade's forces.
sentences.chinese: 虽然不服管，但多法因依然指挥着封锁部队。

sentences.english: At this time, the streets of the staff to do the scene and immediately cordoned off the area.
sentences.chinese: 这时，街道办的工作人员也到场并马上封锁现场。

sentences.english: The harbour was blockaded,so the ships had to lay off.
sentences.chinese: 港口被封锁了，船只只得在港外停泊了。

sentences.english: Everyone is looking for the car. The interstates are all blocked.
sentences.chinese: 每个人都在寻找那辆车，所有的州公路也都封锁了。

sentences.english: In the police cordon the crowd gathered outside a lot.
sentences.chinese: 在警方封锁线外聚集了不少围观群众。

sentences.english: The news of the kidnapping was blacked out until the police could find the child.
sentences.chinese: 有关绑架小孩的消息被封锁着直至警察能找到小孩。

sentences.english: The police usually lock down central Beijing for the duration of the sessions.
sentences.chinese: 在两会期间，警察通常会封锁北京中部。

sentences.english: The workmen closed off the street for repairs.
sentences.chinese: 工人们将大街封锁进行翻修。

sentences.english: Is not this laid up in store with me, and sealed up among my treasures?
sentences.chinese: 这不都是积蓄在我这里，封锁在我府库中吗？

sentences.english: Once the leak is stanched, BP could permanently seal the first well.
sentences.chinese: 一旦漏缝被堵住，就可以永远封锁第一口井。

sentences.english: They are threat ening to impose a blockade on the country.
sentences.chinese: 他们威胁说要对该国实行封锁。

definition: to impose martial law/to impose emergency measures
to block (a road)/to plug (a hole)/to stop up
to monitor/to keep a close watch over/surveillance
to stop/to obstruct/to bar the way
to break or cut in two/to sever/to cut off/(fig.) to cut off (a conversation, a flow etc)/to interrupt/(math.) to truncate
to seal/to close/to confine/to seal off/to close down/sealed/confined/closed/unreceptive
